quiz.question: Which stone is popularly believed to bring protection and clarity when worn as jewelry?
Which European superstition claims stepping on a crack affects your mother's wellbeing?
Which mathematical superstition influenced building design by omitting the thirteenth floor?
Which symbol featuring an eye is commonly used as an amulet against envy and ill intent?
Which amulet shaped like a leaf symbolizes luck in many Western traditions?
Which British folklore figure collects bad luck by sweeping chimneys and became a wedding charm historically?
Which plant is popularly associated with finding good luck and has five leaves when unusual?
What is the name of the protective blue glass bead used in Turkey against the evil eye?
Which classical Roman ritual used a scapegoat to symbolically carry community sins away?
Which day of the week is considered unlucky by some people who fear Friday the 13th?
Which ancient practice interpreted the behavior of birds to predict events?
Which term names fear specifically of the number four in East Asian contexts?
Which animal is commonly considered bad luck in Western superstition if it crosses your path?
What object did sailors historically wear or carry to protect against bad luck at sea?
Which medieval English practice left protective iron objects in walls to deter witches and spirits?
